definitions: The process of identifying and removing duplicate revenue entries within financial records to ensure accurate reporting and prevent overstatement of income.
A data quality initiative focused on eliminating redundant revenue figures that may arise from multiple data sources, system errors, or inconsistent data entry practices.
examples: The finance team implemented revenue deduplication to improve quarterly reports.
Effective revenue deduplication is crucial for accurate tax calculations.
Automated revenue deduplication tools can save significant time.
